purpleculture_pinyin:
hún
muddy; to mix
мутный; смешивать
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 浑)
Antonyms: 清
Pictophonetic: 軍 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
渾身 [ hún shēn ]: all over; from head to foot
渾濁 [ hún zhuó ]: muddy; turbid
渾厚 [ hún hòu ]: simple and honest; unsophisticated; (music etc) deep and resounding
渾然 [ hún rán ]: completely; absolutely; undivided; totally mixed up; muddled
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 軍 [ jūn ] army, military; soldiers, troops
heisig_chinese_memo: The Pharaoh's chariots muddled up the plans when they tried to cross the Red Sea and gushing waters came and crushed them.
Ru_trainchinese: hún: (прил) весь, целиком, полностью; мутный, грязный; простой, безыскусственный; бестолковый, глупый
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the army (軍) in the water (氵) is all of them
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The water chariot which the gods use to travel on water can be easily muddled up with other chariots as they all look the same.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " army " sound. " Muddy " means the sound of water spurting. "Said Wen": "Muddy, mixed sounds. From the water, military sounds." "Yu Pian. "Ministry of Water": "Muddy, the sound of swelling water."

Bronze " hun " is pronounced "郓". Hun Zuo Ge: "Hun (Yun) Zuo." " Yun " is a place name.

" Muddy " means turbid and unclear. Such as "Lao Tzu. Chapter 15: "It is as open as a valley, and muddy as if it is muddy." Tang Dynasty Du Fu, "Showing from Sun Ji": "Taking rice for less water, but more for muddy wells."

" Chaotic " means mixing and confusing. Such as "Han Shu. "The Biography of Dong Zhongshu": "It's a trade disorder with honesty and shame. Sun Xinggong "You Tiantai Mountain Fu": "The omnipresent view is from the meditation, and the body is in the nature."

" Hun " means undivided, as in "Book of Jin. "Wang Rong's Biography": "(Wang) Rong has a human ethics and knowledge, and he tastes mountain waves like raw jade and muddy gold." "Shan Tao" is a huge source of mountains. Wang Rong knows people, thinking that mountains are as natural and simple as uncut jade and unsplit gold.

" Hun " also means whole and whole. For example, Li Bai in the Tang Dynasty: "The young ranger is easy to pass by, and his outfits are all beautiful." Han Yu (Ji Lu): "Every time I ride a house to look down at the mountain, I am afraid of breaking my toes." "Hun Quan" refers to the whole family. .

" Hun " can be used as an adverb, which means almost, almost, as in the Tang Dynasty Du Fu's "Chunwang": "The white-headed scratch is shorter, and the whole body is more than the hairpin." It also means both, as in the Tang Dynasty Wang Jian "Late Autumn Disease": "Shuang The lower wild flowers land on the ground, and the birds do not flock in cold weather." It also said that they still, return, as in the Northern Song Dynasty Wang Anshi's "Ti Huang Sili Garden": "The empty space before the leap is exhausted, and there are no flowers blooming."

" Hun " is often used in common with " mixed ", and the two characters have the meaning of being merged into one, and they often have similar meanings. Later on there is a growing use differentiation, " mixed " hybridity represents more than justice, and " muddy " is more seamless represent justice. So "whole body", "totally" and other multi-use " muddy " instead of " mixed ." (Wang Fengyang)

" Hun " also refers to the theory of the whole world, which is an ancient cosmology, which believed that the shape of the heaven and the earth was perfectly round like an egg. The sky is wrapped around the earth, like an eggshell with egg yolk. "Song Shu. "Astronomical History": "There are three people who speak of heaven, one is Xuanye, the second is to cover the sky, and the third is to cover the sky." Tang Dynasty Yang Jiong "Hun Tiantian": "The person who speaks to the celestial body is unknown." "Hun Gai" means Hun Tian and Gai Tian.

" Hun " is also the provincial name of the ancient minority Tuyuhun. "Old Tang Book. "Guo Ziyi Biography": "The land of the river and long, mixed with the people of Qiang and Huns." It is also the name of the river, referring to the Hun River.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " army ". " Muddy " means the sound of water spurting.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「軍」聲。「渾」表示水噴涌聲。《說文》：「渾，混流聲也。从水，軍聲。」《玉篇．水部》：「渾，水濆涌之聲。」

　　金文「渾」讀為「鄆」。渾左戈：「渾（鄆）左。」「鄆」是地名。

　　「渾」表示混濁、不清澈。如《老子．第十五章》：「曠兮其若谷，渾兮其若濁。」唐代杜甫〈示從孫濟〉：「淘米少汲水，汲多井水渾。」

　　「渾」表示混合、混同。如《漢書．董仲舒傳》：「是以廉恥貿亂，賢不肖渾殽，未得其真。」《文選．孫興公〈游天台山賦〉》：「渾萬象以冥觀，兀同體於自然。」

　　「渾」表示未分剖，如《晉書．王戎傳》：「（王）戎有人倫鑒識，嘗目山濤如璞玉渾金。」「山濤」即山巨源。王戎識人，以為山濤如未加雕琢的玉、未分剖的金一樣，天然質樸。

　　「渾」又表示全、整個。如唐代李白〈少年行〉：「少年游俠好經過，渾身裝束皆綺羅。」韓愈〈寄盧〉：「每騎屋山下窺闞，渾舍驚怕走折趾。」「渾全」指全家。

　　「渾」可作副詞，表示簡直、幾乎，如唐代杜甫〈春望〉：「白頭搔更短，渾欲不勝簪。」又表示皆、都，如唐代王建〈晚秋病中〉：「霜下野花渾著地，寒來溪鳥不成群。」亦表示仍、還，如北宋王安石〈題黃司理園〉：「閏前空臘盡，渾未有花開。」

　　「渾」常與「混」通用，二字都有合而為一、互相雜糅的意思，經常表示相近的意義。後來在使用上逐漸有分化，「混」多表示雜糅義，而「渾」則多表示渾然一體義。故「渾身」、「渾然」等多用「渾」而不用「混」。（王鳳陽）

　　「渾」也指渾天說，是古代一種宇宙觀，認為天地的形狀渾圓像雞蛋。天包覆地，就像蛋殼包著蛋黃一樣。《宋書．天文志》：「言天者有三家，一曰宣夜，二曰蓋天，三曰渾天。」唐代楊炯〈渾天賦〉：「代之言天體者，未知渾蓋孰是。」「渾蓋」即渾天說和蓋天說。

　　「渾」還是古代少數民族吐谷渾的省稱。《舊唐書．郭子儀傳》：「兼河隴之地，雜羌渾之眾。」又是河名，指渾河。
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「軍」聲。「渾」表示水噴涌聲。

English Definition: muddy; to mix

Total strokes: 12; Radical: 水
Pictophonetic: 軍 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:

    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 軍 [ jūn ] army, military; soldiers, troops

渾濁 [ hún zhuó ]: muddy; turbid
渾厚 [ hún hòu ]: simple and honest; unsophisticated; (music etc) deep and resounding
渾然 [ hún rán ]: completely; absolutely; undivided; totally mixed up; muddled

HSK 6: 渾,混,魂,浑
(Simplified: 浑)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 清
Pictophonetic: 軍 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 軍 [ jūn ] army, military; soldiers, troops
①水不清，污濁：渾水摸魚。渾濁。
②罵人糊塗，不明事理：渾人。渾話。渾蛋。渾渾噩噩。
③全，滿：渾身。渾然。
④天然的，淳樸的：渾古。渾樸。渾厚。
⑤簡直：“白頭搔更短，渾欲不勝簪。”
⑥姓氏。

渾濁 [ hún zhuó ]: muddy; turbid
渾厚 [ hún hòu ]: simple and honest; unsophisticated; (music etc) deep and resounding
渾然 [ hún rán ]: completely; absolutely; undivided; totally mixed up; muddled

Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 清

Chinese: The Pharaoh's chariots muddled up the plans when they tried to cross the Red Sea and gushing waters came and crushed them.
Meaning: muddled
Hanzi: 浑
Story: The water chariot which the gods use to travel on water can be easily muddled up with other chariots as they all look the same.
Kind: traditional

從「 水 」，「 軍 」聲。「 渾 」表示水噴涌聲。《說文》：「渾，混流聲也。从水，軍聲。」《玉篇．水部》：「渾，水濆涌之聲。」 金文「 渾 」讀為「 鄆 」。渾左戈：「渾（鄆）左。」「 鄆 」是地名。 「 渾 」表示混濁、不清澈。如《老子．第十五章》：「曠兮其若谷，渾兮其若濁。」唐代杜甫〈示從孫濟〉：「淘米少汲水，汲多井水渾。」 「 渾 」表示混合、混同。如《漢書．董仲舒傳》：「是以廉恥貿亂，賢不肖渾殽，未得其真。」《文選．孫興公〈游天台山賦〉》：「渾萬象以冥觀，兀同體於自然。」 「 渾 」表示未分剖，如《晉書．王戎傳》：「（王）戎有人倫鑒識，嘗目山濤如璞玉渾金。」「山濤」即山巨源。王戎識人，以為山濤如未加雕琢的玉、未分剖的金一樣，天然質樸。 「 渾 」又表示全、整個。如唐代李白〈少年行〉：「少年游俠好經過，渾身裝束皆綺羅。」韓愈〈寄盧〉：「每騎屋山下窺闞，渾舍驚怕走折趾。」「渾全」指全家。 「 渾 」可作副詞，表示簡直、幾乎，如唐代杜甫〈春望〉：「白頭搔更短，渾欲不勝簪。」又表示皆、都，如唐代王建〈晚秋病中〉：「霜下野花渾著地，寒來溪鳥不成群。」亦表示仍、還，如北宋王安石〈題黃司理園〉：「閏前空臘盡，渾未有花開。」 「 渾 」常與「 混 」通用，二字都有合而為一、互相雜糅的意思，經常表示相近的意義。後來在使用上逐漸有分化，「 混 」多表示雜糅義，而「 渾 」則多表示渾然一體義。故「渾身」、「渾然」等多用「 渾 」而不用「 混 」。（王鳳陽） 「 渾 」也指渾天說，是古代一種宇宙觀，認為天地的形狀渾圓像雞蛋。天包覆地，就像蛋殼包著蛋黃一樣。《宋書．天文志》：「言天者有三家，一曰宣夜，二曰蓋天，三曰渾天。」唐代楊炯〈渾天賦〉：「代之言天體者，未知渾蓋孰是。」「渾蓋」即渾天說和蓋天說。 「 渾 」還是古代少數民族吐谷渾的省稱。《舊唐書．郭子儀傳》：「兼河隴之地，雜羌渾之眾。」又是河名，指渾河。

渾字的基本解释

渾
hún
见“浑”。

渾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hún］
［《廣韻》户昆切，平魂，匣。］
“湷2”的被通假字。“浑1”的繁体字。
(1)大水涌流声。
(2)浑浊。
(3)混同；混合。
(4)指男女相通。
(5)连带；连同。
(6)全，整个。
(7)副词。简直；几乎。
(8)副词。还；仍旧。表示频率。
(9)副词。皆；都。表示范围。
(10)吐谷浑的省称。
(11)姓。春秋郑有浑罕。见《左传·昭公四年》。
[②]［hún］
［《廣韻》胡本切，上混，匣。］
“浑2”的繁体字。“昆2”的被通假字。
(1)大。
(2)糊涂。
(3)质朴；朴厚。
(4)纯，无杂质。
(5)浑天。我国古代关于天体的一种学说。
(6)指浑天仪。
[③]［hùn］
［《廣韻》胡本切，上混，匣。］
“浑3”的繁体字。
(1)混杂；混淆。
(2)蒙混。
(3)胡乱。
(4)苟且度过；苟且获取。
(5)逗趣的，开玩笑的。
[④]［gǔn］
［《集韻》古本切，上混，見。］

渾字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　渾； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页635第23
【唐韻】戸昆切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】胡昆切，?音魂。【說文】混流聲。【枚乗·七發】沌沌渾渾。【註】渾渾，波相隨貌。　又洿下貌。又濁也。【老子·道德經】渾兮其若濁。　又大也。【班固·幽通賦】渾元運物。　又肧渾，言如肧胎之渾然也。【郭璞·江賦】類肧渾之未凝。　又齊同也。【孫綽·天台賦】渾萬象以冥觀。　又【集韻】戸袞切，音溷。豐流也。一曰雜流。【前漢·劉向傳】賢不肖渾淆。　又【揚子·方言】渾，盛也。【註】們渾，肥滿也。　又【爾雅·釋詁】渾，墜也。【註】水落貌。　又姓。【左傳】鄭大夫渾罕。　又古本切，音袞。與滾同。大水流貌。【荀子·富國篇】財貨渾渾如泉源。

渾字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
渾字的起名意思

暂无。

muddy
Basic explanation of words
muddy
hún
See "muddy".
muddy
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hún］
["Guangyun" Hu Kunqie, Ping Hun, Xia. ]
The false word for "湷2" was passed. Traditional characters for "Hun 1".
(1) The sound of surging water.
(2) Turbidity.
(3) Mixed; mixed.
(4) Refers to the communication between men and women.
(5) Jointly; together.
(6) Whole, whole.
(7) Adverbs. Simply; almost.
(8) Adverbs. Still; still. Indicates frequency.
(9) Adverbs. All; all. Indicates the scope.
(10) The provincial name of Tuyuhun.
(11) Last name. Chunqiu Zheng Youhunhan. See "Zuo Zhuan · Zhaogong Four Years".
[②]［hún］
["Guangyun" Hu Benqie, upmix, box. ]
Traditional characters for "Hun 2". "Kun 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Big.
(2) Confused.
(3) Simple; simple and thick.
(4) Pure, no impurities.
(5) Chaotic sky. A theory of celestial bodies in ancient my country.
(6) Refers to the armillary sphere.
[③]［hùn］
["Guangyun" Hu Benqie, upmix, box. ]
Traditional characters for "Hun 3".
